reviewText: This is a pretty standard television movie. It is about how a fireman who has lost his wife befriends a writer who he saves from an apartment fire. I won't give away the plot but suffice it to say that it is fairly typical for this kind of movie. That being said, it is still an enjoyable movie to watch, mostly because the characters are interesting and likable and the plot doesn't involve any violence or explicit material. This lends an air of realism to the story. The only thing that's a little odd about this one is that the female character seems a bit like a stalker as she sneaks up and takes photos of people for books she is supposedly writing. Fortunately, these scenes are short and don't detract significantly from the story. If you like a low-key and wholesome love story, it's worth checking this out.
summary: Pretty good for a TV movie

reviewText: So I was looking in the Christian section for movies, and how was this an option??This movie features almost two hours of an alright story plot, LACED with alcohol all through it.As a Christian, I am glad that I had no children, because this was not Christian home, nor child friendly. They advertise Coor's Light, wine, and other forms of liquor which is not appropriate. Not to mention its a poor quality film. Not high def like today's movies are.The makers of this movie should be ashamed of themselves if this was in fact Christian. Dont let the name fool you. This movie does not speak about God, the Bible, Prayer, or anything. Its called "for the Love of Grace", but its basically a plot centered around a very short scene of a man saving Graces life in a fire (although you do not get to see how he gets her out of the fire), and from there she cant get this guy off her mind, to the point where in the end she breaks off her wedding to a wealthy fiance (Cliff), for this fireman who lost his wife a while back (Steve).Overall Assessment:Alcohol-centered movieNo God at all.Very poor plot.Not easy to follow.Boring to say the least.Choppy in between scenesCant believe I used 2.99 on this.Dont waste your money....especially if you are looking in the Christian section for "Christian" movies.
summary: Alcohol in every scene.  How is this in the Christian movie section?

reviewText: This is one of those movies that the men in my family refer to as the "Hallmark formula". The successful young woman is on the career fast-track and is paired up with a man that is the same. Something life-changing occurs and the woman realizes she wants something (really someone) different, and luckily that something different is close at hand.Grace is a very workoholic author of "how-to" books. She works in the same office with her best friend, who is being married at the opening of the movie. Grace, who rarely has time for their friendship anymore, is her maid of honor.When Graces' apartment catches fire she is rescued by a recently suspended firefighter, Steve, who seems to have a death wish since his own wife died. He just happens to be passing by her place when the fire is getting out of control. Grace's second chance at life gives her a fresh perspective and it spills over in gratitude to the firefighter who saved her. There are barriers between them, however. He still wears his wedding ring and barely goes through the motions of living, and she sports a flashy engagement ring.She makes an awkward attempt to help him by setting him up with a coworker, but eventually does help him start to find pleasure in living again. He also helps her find joy in serving in a local soup kitchen, and in donating proceeds from her next book (a  cookbook of the firefighter's gourmet recipes) to help the kitchen survive.It is very predictable, but that doesn't mean it isn't enjoyable. It is pretty clean. There is one very low neckline, two incidents of profanity and onecommon swear word. The main characters are storybook good looking, and comic relief is provided by Steve's brother Frank.
summary: No surprises, but a good chick flick

reviewText: For the Love of Grace is about a man named Steve Lockwood (Mark Consuelos) who is a fireflighter who is dealing with missing his wife, Molly who died in a car accident. Steve tries to keep his mind focused on his job.  One night after work he saves a young woman's life named Grace Harlen (Chandra West) from an apartment fire.  Grace is a freelance-author.  When Grace is all better she goes to the firehouse to thank Steve in person, but she learns that Steve is taking a break from the firehouse.  Grace and Steve eventually meet in person.  When Grace was last at the firehouse  she sees something very interesting, the firemen cook their meals working together as a team.  Grace gets an idea for a subject for her next book.  Steve and Grace hang out alot together. Then Steve learns Grace is engaged to a guy named Cliff (Kevin Jubinville) who is a businessman. Steve realizes he can not live without Grace. Watch this movie to see what happens to Steve and Grace.  Does Grace marry Cliff or Steve? Watch it and find out.

reviewText: Yes, these Hallmark love stories can be quite predictable and overly sugary.  This one, I felt started somewhat slow but then develops into a very pleasant, interesting, relationship story.It's not really a romantic comedy where the main players initially can't stand each other or have a misunderstanding for the first half of the movie, and/or there's a gimmick, e.g., they have to pretend to be married for some special event even though they 'hate' each other.  There's no problem with that, but this one simply stresses the interactions between decent people.  Plus, even though there is comedy here, it's light and non-obtrusive.Briefly: two people both with deep hurts cross paths, so to speak.  One's a fireman(Mark Consuelos), not wanting anything to do with finding a relationship, saves the other, a successful, apparently happily, engaged, businesswoman(Chandra West), from a fire.  She, in turn, reaches out to him in thanks and in a way rescues him, too.All the characters come across nice and supportive in there own ways.  There's no mean people here like a back stabbing ex-friend or a creepy fiance. There just different people with different needs.  And the leads go through a wonderfully, warm process of self(and of course, of each other) discovery and growth.The ending offers the possibility of one of those frantic, crazy finales, but then turns quite reasonable and sensible.  All's well that ends well.  And this one does. If you're in need of something more gritty or less certain, seek other fair to watch, this is pure romantic escapism.Mark Consuelos born in Zaragoza, Spain is married in real life to Kelly Ripa both from All My Children fame, and Chandra West, born in Canada, performed recently in The Gates.  They're both charming and work well together.  Corbin Bernson plays the tough but sympathetic fire captain.
summary: Surprisingly Good Romance with a Touch of Humor
